snippet: A man who called himself Abu Bilal al-Homsi fought the government during the siege of his city, Homs, and briefed the media on battles. But as hunger set in, he turned to ISIS.
abstract: Saturday Profile of Abu Bilal al-Homsi, Syrian rebel and media activist who unexpectedly became suicide bomber for Islamic State after siege of Homs; many of Abu Bilal's friends and family were surprised at his radicalization, which they attribute to maddening environment in city during siege.

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and ANNE BARNARD

lead_paragraph: A man who called himself Abu Bilal al-Homsi fought the government during the siege of his city, Homs, and briefed the media on battles. But as hunger set in, he turned to ISIS.

headline.print_headline: Syrian’s Journey From Hometown Rebel to ISIS
headline.main: One Syrian’s Journey From Hometown Rebel to ISIS Bomber

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
